Nic James Ferrier schrieb:
> You're right that Roy's dissertaion doesn't say anything about webdav.

But then it also doesn't say anything about a *specific* set of methods.

Believe it or not, the set of methods currently defined in RFC2616 is 
not the result of a big design plan; it just happens that those methods 
that weren't widely used at some point of time were taken out (probably 
due to the standards process), and were left for subsequent efforts to 
be picked up, such as WebDAV.

Whether or not all WebDAV methods have been defined *well*, and whether 
they are all needed, is a separate discussion. But just because 
something doesn't appear in RFC2616 doesn't make it not "restful" per 
se. Consider LINK or PATCH, for example.

> ...

Best regards, Julian
